avalancheActivity.comment: Still low avalanche danger. Dander spots can be located in high altitudes in the expositions north to east and behind ridgelines. There slab avalanches could be triggered in extremly steep slopes by high additional loads.
avalancheActivity.highlights: No significant change of the avalanche danger. Caution: snowdrift accumulations in shady areas!

snowpackStructure.comment: The new snow could settle due to sun radiation. In high altitudes small amounts of snowdrift accumulations have formed which partially are on top of faceted snow. The new snow is covering an old snow cover which weakened due to kinetic metamorphosis in high altitudes it is on top of a hard old snow cover.

tendency.highlights: The avalanche danger is not significantly changing. Monday morning starts with dense clouds and some snowfall. During the course of the day it clears up and it can be sunny in some regions. In the western part of upper Styria it will clear up sooner.

weatherForecast.comment: On Sunday overcast with compact clouds over the Styrian mountains. The ceiling will be above the most peaks. Visibility is good. In the northern Alps snowfall is possible from noon on. Weakly winds coming from variable directions. Temperatures in 2.000 are around -6 degrees at noon.

customData.generalHeadline: Little amount of new snow - avalanche danger still low!
